website_summaries.verdict: The OXO salt grinder lives up the nicely designed and functional standards of this brand.
pros: Ceramic grinder constructed to not absorb odors
Heavy duty enough for daily use
Good ergonomic design is a nice choice for people with arthritis
cons: While there are several grind setting on this unit, the difference in the salt when you use them is not really perceptible

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't grind pepper!
customer_reviews.text: Worst pepper grinder. It grinds well when it actually grabs the peppercorns, but 90% of the time it takes 10-15 turns of nothing and then a few good turns of pepper are ground, then nothing again. It does this no matter the coarseness setting or orientation of the grinder, even with the peppercorns that came with it! I'm not sure if I got a lemon on this one, but I'll be going back to my reliable Kuhn grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge difference in grind settings. I guess the finest is fine enough, but could be finer. It's easy to grip and turn.
customer_reviews.author: CMT926Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Easy Refilling, No Mess on the Table
customer_reviews.text: This pepper mill grinds easily and quickly, so it doesn't take long to get the quantity you need for a recipe or for your plate at the table. It has an adjustment to change the grounds from coarse to finer (not a great deal of difference, but still a nice option). The grinder sits on the part you turn, so you're not left with pepper on the table or counter. The cap for refilling removes easily and covers a fairly large opening for easy filling. I've been using and enjoying this grinder for about three weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Dory

customer_reviews.title: This is the poorest excuse for a pepper grinder I've ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the poorest excuse for a pepper grinder I've ever used. Don't buy it if you don't want to struggle to get just a bit of pepper to grind. P.S. I just discovered that Oxo has a real Satisfaction Guarantee policy. I have contacted them and they are sending me a replacement grinder. If the new one proves the current one defective, I'll be changing my rating. Stay tuned.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dianne Mize

customer_reviews.title: Buy it - great coarse grinder!
customer_reviews.text: *Update January 2018, been nearly 2 years and still love this grinder! Never a problem and it is used daily! Still highly recommend for a coarse grind! I am a pepper guru and this is hands down the best grinder I've had. And I've tried about 6. Hope it lasts cause I'll be using it daily. Highly recommend if you're looking for a coarse grinder. Even the finest setting is more coarse than my other grinders.. Which is exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: CGB

customer_reviews.title: just because something is an 'Amazon best seller', doesn't mean it is built with quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Less than two months after receiving this grinder, a spring in the grinding mechanism had become dislodged from the grinding shaft and subsequently made it impossible to grind the pepper. I should have expected that out of a 16 dollar pepper grinder. Amazon refunded my purchase, but beware, just because something is an 'Amazon best seller', doesn't mean it is built with quality in mind. If you are looking for a cheap/economically priced pepper grinder, buy the disposable pepper grinders from your local Publix/grocer. If you want something more durable, shell out the money for a more reputable brand. like Cole and Mason, or something of that caliber. Skip this product.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Bradford

customer_reviews.title: It looked like the perfect little grinder
customer_reviews.text: After complete satisfaction with all of OXO products over several decades (and I own many) I have to say this pepper grinder is a major failure. I returned the first unit and was promptly sent another. They both had the same problem; they only grind/work intermittently and the grind size adjustment is completely ineffective. It looked like the perfect little grinder; it’s not, at least the two I received. I have given massive praise to all the OXO products I have purchased up until now. I hope they make the proper modifications to it because I really want one that functions properly.
customer_reviews.author: Dontripmeoff

customer_reviews.title: OXI salt grinder.
customer_reviews.text: OXO products rarely disappoint. This salt grinder is perfect for my purposes. The shape, ease of use, size and style work very well. The dial to adjust the grind level is excellent as one can vary it to any level not fixed stations. I’d buy again and recommend this product. Wish it came with Himalayan pink sea salt but the design makes it simple to refill!
customer_reviews.author: C. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend! Such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this thing after all the great reviews but it’s awful. My peppers just swirl around inside as I’m trying to grind them and I have tried every single setting trying to make it catch the peppers seeds better. I have to continually shake it to catch the seeds as I continue to try and grind and finally achieve enough pepper. Such a disappointment and can not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KEB

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Actually Grind the Pepper
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is an upside down pepper mill since I was tired of wiping out my cabinet all the time from my old one. But, after only 3 months it no longer grinds the peppercorns. I turn and turn and barely anything comes out. I think the gear is already stripped. Total waste of money. Will be purchasing another grinder with a metal gear this time. Disappointing. :(
customer_reviews.author: A Reasonable Person

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Pepper Grinder .... you’ll be lucky if it works .....
customer_reviews.text: I bought the salt and pepper set ..... from day 1, the Pepper grinder never worked as it should ...... the courseness selector made no difference ...... it seemed to ‘slip’ on the peppercorns and never ground them ...... changing peppercorn brands did not help ...... It’s a nice set however, and had the pepper grinder worked as it should, this would be a five star rating .... When buying the set, I would suggest buying two of the salt grinders ..... you can see the product that’s in it ..... your not going to make a mistake when using it .... something is wrong with the manufacturing of the pepper grinder ...... just don’t chance it .....
customer_reviews.author: C. Green

customer_reviews.title: Buy them! Great product from OXO
customer_reviews.text: Really like that you can choose the size of the grind, fits in hand extremely well, and easy to refill If this review was helpful please let me know by clicking the “Helpful” button below the review.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We love Celtic salt and made the mistake of ordering a 5lb bag of the courser variety. I tried grinding it but, it was lumpy and stuck together, making it difficult to apply the right amount evenly distributed on the food. Instead of putting it down to bad luck and buying another bag of the finer variety, we decided to try this grinder and it works great! It will more than pay for itself in the longer run as we will now order the course variety and save about $10 a bag over the cost of the fine grain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best grinder on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 8 salt/pepper grinders in the past 2 years and they have all broken. One of them broke the first time I used it. The grinder part comes apart or the glass shatters. Some of them broke when they fell over on the counter. Seriously? Can they not make one of these without glass or protect the glass so it doesn't shatter so easily. I have had this one for several months and it is still working. I was ready to give up on ground pepper again! I will report back if anything changes but am ordering another for my pepper today. Finally!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Varn

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked as easily as it is promised too.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor grinder. Looks good and seemed like it was going to be a very EASY grinder but it is not, it is not difficult to operate but the grinder never seems to catch any of the pepper corns to actually grind up. I just twist and twist the handle with no results. I have shaken it, used it at an angle, put pressure on the spinning handle and even filled the reservoir to max capacity hoping that being that full would force the grinder to spit out some freshly ground up pepper but to no avail. Now, when it does actually catch it works like a dream and it's super easy to select what size grinds one prefers.
customer_reviews.author: R.A.Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this pepper grinder unless you want a mess every time you use it.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this pepper grinder, the bottom fell out and all the pepper came out. The bottom lid does not match up with the grooves so fitting it in in the first place is painful. Once you get it in, even if you tighten it all the way, it will still pop open on you. I'd learned to get it to stay for a few months but now it just broke open spilling the pepper all over the floor. This product is broken.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Oxo just makes the best stuff. I've gone through 3 or 4 different salt and pepper shakers that didn't even make it a few months before something broke on it. These Oxo grinders have lasted for years with no issues. They are high quality, versatile and easy to use. I started out with just the pepper grinder, but fell in love with how user friendly it was so had to get this salt one. You won't regret it. I love that you can adjust the grind and it's easy to refill from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: oakandleaf

customer_reviews.title: needs a more stable base
customer_reviews.text: Grinds pepper, fairly ergonomic, pepper grind size is appropriate for my household, but perhaps not for others. Big problem is its top heavy, and has a base width that matches the top. As a result, is the #1 item in my house that gets knocked over. Also, i have cats, and they love rubbing against things. 9 times out of 10, when i hear something fall over in the middle of the night, its this thing. Even on a table full of bottles, other grinders, candles etc. needs to be remade with a larger stable base.
customer_reviews.author: H C

customer_reviews.title: OXO Soft Works Salt Mill Grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased several years ago the matching pepper mill. What I liked about it was the ability to adjust the grind from fine to coarse. This mill is the same but with a white top. This mill like the pepper mill is able to be filled by turning the mill upside down & unscrewing the cover. This keeps any pepper or salt grains from laying on the countertop when not in use. Thanks for a great attractive & easy to use mill.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this grinder based on positive reviews, but it hasn't worked for me. I've tried different peppercorns, ways of holding it, adjusting the coarseness to no end, but nothing seems to better it's performance. It halts grinding, like it can't 'catch' the peppercorns. I want pepper to rain down, and this grinder doesn't come close. It's a simple but crucial tool, and I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Henry

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work. I have been out of town since this arrived and just started using it. It works for a few grinds then nothing comes out. I have tried emptying some of the pepper out and still no change. I would return it, but I have had it over a month. Unfortunately, I just ordered the salt grinder to match this one!! So, I will return the salt grinder.
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

customer_reviews.title: Does not produce much ground pepper
customer_reviews.text: NIce little grinder but it fails to do what it's name implies. The selector knob moves from the large medium and small particle size positions but the size of the pepper particles does not change much at all. In addition sometimes it just stops grinding and nothing comes out at all. I found that tapping it on the counter top helps get it going again but overall this thing is a loser.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Devitalis

customer_reviews.title: I Dream of Pepper Now
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after hearing it rated the highest on American's Test Kitchen when discussing pepper grinders. I thought I would need to shell out at least $80 and have a massive wood one to get the quality from this OXO brand. I'm THRILLED with it. Seriously... it sounds really stupid, but "Where have you been all my life!?" The adjustable grind works great. The twist part for grinding is textured and very easy to grab and turn. I can't imagine every owning another pepper mill.
customer_reviews.author: Creatress

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works well at first but I’ve had it for a month now and I hate it. Almost every single time I use it, it stops working. I’ll have food burning in my pan while I’m struggling to get some pepper out of it. This stupid grinder makes me so frustrated that it’s taking my joy out of cooking. Just ordered a different one, this is going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Pepper Grinder that does NOT grind
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder because it was the number one grinder on amazon. It doesn’t grind pepper well at all. If you turn the handle five complete rotations, you will be lucky if you actually grind pepper on 1.5 rotations. It seems that the grinder just doesn’t “catch” the peppercorns. You can shake it right side up or upside down. You can bang it on the counter. Doesn’t matter. Still won’t catch peppercorns (and no, these aren’t mutant giant peppercorns or abnormally tiny peppercorns - just standard grocery store fare). I’m returning this and trying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Ektar

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT bother
customer_reviews.text: This thing has one function. Grind peppercorns. Yet it has made something so simple the most frustrating part of cooking. I really thought it was just me but in a rage of desperation tonight I asked the other members of the house if it was just me, we have a consensus. The damn thing does not work. You can shake it, bang it, then shake it some more and you might start getting pepper from the unit. So it is off to try to find something that actually works, and works well, and works easily. I just want to grind pepper.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! But after a few months, it just stopped grinding. I emptied and thoroughly washed and dried it. Not sure if the grinding parts wore down? The resolution on Amazon is to contact manufacturer so I went to their site and filled out an online form. Never heard back, but did receive an email asking me to rate my interaction with the agent. Oxo is a good company which is one reason I bought this. Disappointed in them.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Great pepper shaker.
customer_reviews.text: I go grocery shopping with my dad every weekend and he saw this pepper and salt shakers at Ralph’s. Mentioned to me that he would love them as a Christmas present. I quickly took a picture of them without him knowing so I could see if they were sold on amazon and sure enough they are! He’s been telling me daily how much he loves them as he uses them every night when he cooks.
customer_reviews.author: JBMTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I've always had good luck with OXO stuff, but this pepper grinder is THE WORST!!!! Simply put, it doesn't work. It doesn't matter what coarseness setting I select, it won't grind much beyond a bit of pepper dust. Every once in a while it will sort of work for a few twists before giving up the ghost again. I'd have better luck crushing my peppercorns with a hammer. Then I can crush this piece of junk with the hammer.
customer_reviews.author: A. N.

customer_reviews.title: Small and difficult to adjust.
customer_reviews.text: The grind is fairly consistent, but it's difficult to adjust the coarseness and it's difficult to use. The grinder is small for my hands and my husband finds it almost impossible to use. Edit: after using this for a few months, I don't care for this grinder at all. The adjustment switch is impossible to move. Apparently there's salt getting in the slide from somewhere clogging the works. I'll be ordering something different.
customer_reviews.author: Mp376

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing performance!
customer_reviews.text: I am a faithful purchaser of Oxo products. I already owned one of these pepper grinders & just wanted an additional one. The one I have is easy to use & does just what it is supposed to do. I am disappointed in this newest one. No matter what you set the grind to, it only puts out finely ground pepper, much like what you'd get from a pepper shaker. This is not why you buy a pepper mill and certainly not what I've come to expect from Oxo.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Wavra-Mouch

customer_reviews.title: I really like OXO products
customer_reviews.text: I really like OXO products, but I am very unhappy with this grinder. It is almost silent, so you can't tell if you're even getting any pepper out of it at all. I have to turn it almost sideways to get it to work. Then, after a few grinds I have to violently shake it. The whole reason I bought this more expensive brand was that I wanted a pepper grinder that was high quality, so I am really bummed it stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Delger

customer_reviews.title: Loved it at first.....
customer_reviews.text: This pepper grinder came filled with peppercorns and worked fantastic until the peppercorns were about half used. Then it would only grind about every 4-5th turn and only would grind for one turn. I refilled with peppercorns and changed the size of the grain thinking maybe that would fix the problem. Unfortunately, it did not work and remains in the same condition I described. I loved it at first and have given it many chances to be useful again, but no luck. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MP Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Sad that it is this bad, most OXO things are really good.  I wish it was great but it is not..
customer_reviews.text: I have some really good pepper grinders and hoped that this one would be a lower cost answer to fill my needs.. Sorrily is is almost worthless. I have Perfex and some Unicorn grinders and they are so far superior than this one that it is almost un-measurable. I have discarded all of the shipping materiel or I would send it back. I guess it is a lesson learned, I am going to (in the next few minutes) order a mini Unicorn grinder to grind my black pepper without grief.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Stock

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes...OXO came through!
customer_reviews.text: I contacted OXO and they have sent a replacement item. I still have high hopes. I like that the ground salt comes out the top and not the bottom. Filling is super easy as is adjusting the grind. Ordered July 2. Broken on December 26. We are a family of 3 who are not home much. This item did not even make it 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: Peppercorns don't easily drop into the burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: The grinder spits out ground pepper breifly, then stops. The force to turn the grinder goes to near zero and looking at the inside, it appears the grinder has difficulty letting new peppercorns drop into the burr grinder. The throat is narrow. I even tried just a few peppercorns, thinking they mighy be jamming. Same result. Scrambled eggs would be tolerable. A Sunday roast will be annoying. Grinding pepper for a BBQ rub is awful. Maybe nobody actually used it to grind pepper before hitting the go button. The cap seems hard to remove for refills. I'll be buying another peppermill at some point in time.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Ended, the Pepper-grindr-wars have.
customer_reviews.text: I had a garbage pepper shaker. My buddy moved in for a month so he'd have a place while he finished his thesis. When he moved out, i hid his bomb-af pepper grinder in the freezer so I could keep it. I loved it for years. Then I forgot, he visited, sussed out what I had done and silently took it back. Then I stole it again. Then another friend stole it from me. Now I've bought this one and we at last can know peace.
customer_reviews.author: Tobias L Merriman

customer_reviews.title: grind your life away
customer_reviews.text: low volume output worst grinder I have ever used. never worked correctly always took way to long to grind enough peppercorns. perhaps it is a defective unit the cap over the tension screw came off after first use but this is only a cosmetic defect. i haven't actually timed it but it does take about 5 minutes to get a teaspoon of ground pepper out of this grinder. not sure if there is any help from oxo perhaps i'll contact them and see if there is any solution or help. I will update this if there is a resolution.
customer_reviews.author: orchis

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me, But you better want medium grind only.....
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this grinder, although features adjustable grind settings, the grinds are very similar. I use this grinder primarily at the stove, There I don't want a coarse grind, only a medium grind. I am happy for my purpose, If you are looking for and OXO grinder from fine to coarse,,,,....this should not be your choice. Other OXO's will perform better. OXO has a Salt and pepper SET that works perfectly. I ADORE the top fill design. Easy to fill and no more pepper leftovers on my countertop.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but beware...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same pepper grinder a while back and it was a piece of junk. Because of pricing I bought the same product again, knowing that I could return it, and now for some reason this one is a whole lot better. But beware.....
customer_reviews.author: GT500

customer_reviews.title: I thought this would last...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pepper grinder in April 2018. I really liked the design, and at first I thought I had found THE grinder for use in cooking. Most of the time, the peppercorns would be engaged in the grinder. I would shake it to get the peppercorns down into the grinder, and sometimes that would do it. But more and more often, I had trouble getting the grinder to engage. Finally, after about 6 months, it quit grinding altogether. I'm so disappointed. I think I'll try contacting the manufacturer to see if I can get a replacement. A grinder lasting only a few months is not acceptable!
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Peppercorns can't reach the grinding mill
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. The neck where the peppercorns are supposed to pass through to the grinder is too narrow and the corns do not reliably reach the grinding mill. You have to gently knock it against the counter top to help encourage the corns into the business end. Went back to using my old pepper mill that this was intended to replace. Normally have had good luck with OXO products but not with this one. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Hate it so so so so much, cant do its one job.
customer_reviews.text: Hate it so much. Splurged on a pepper grinder because I hate when I turn it and it doesnt grind any pepper, this one does exactly that but even worse then the cheap one I wanted to replace. What is the point of a pepper grinder that literally does not grind pepper. This evaluation was based on months of use so you know that it really does not do its job. I hate it so much, cannot emphasize this point enough.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Mittelstadt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us!
customer_reviews.text: After buying numerous prefilled salt grinders only to have the majority of them getting 'stuck' or not grinding at all, I found the OXO salt grinder! It is wonderful! It's easy to hold, you select the coarseness you want and it actually works! Haven't had to fill it yet but confident that will be a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stores your pepper corns and grinds it on demand
customer_reviews.text: Which is exactly what I needed, so its a great replacement for an electric one that recently broke. The rubberized grips are a nice touch, although mostly aesthetics as the torque necessary to crush a pepper corn isn't much, but I an see value if you had slippery hands, or maybe reduced grip strength. The adjustable slider is nice if you want finer pepper for your general meal seasoning, and larger pieces of pepper for your fresh green salad.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Decided to revise this after having used it for awhile. Real smooth pepper grinder, takes no effort to turn the nob, which is easy grip, the pepper corns grind up well, and you have an array of adjustments from very coarse to finer. It is well built of good materials. Refilling is very easy. Both of us love this gadget, it works perfectly and doesn't hurt my arthritic hands to grind with. Congratulations to the designer and builder of this pepper grinder. We owned and operated restaurants for a very long time, and used a lot of pepper mills, this is the best for home use. No compensation was received for this review.
customer_reviews.author: Curt O

customer_reviews.title: Really doesn't work well at all
customer_reviews.text: I got this on the recommendation of a friend who has one. Theirs works great but what I got from Amazon is a dog, unfortunately too late to return it. The settings don't make much difference in the grind size and it grinds very, very, little when it does work. I changed the pepper corns to make sure they were fresh and still doesn't do the job. The disposable grinders from the grocery store work better than this thing. I'm very disappointed in this item. And by the way, what the heck does "Sheerness" mean in the features ranking?
customer_reviews.author: Al Russell

customer_reviews.title: The coarse isn't much better than fine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a couple of years ago and really liked it. I like my pepper really really coarse. The first purchase worked very well. So well that I bought another and have them placed at restaurants where I eat a lot. Well, someone else liked my pepper grinder and made off with it. So, I ordered a new one. It didn't work nearly as well as the original. So, I returned it and reordered another one. It also didn't work well. They must have changed the settings. Now, I only have the fine pepper that one restaurant has in those tiny little shakers.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Dennig

customer_reviews.title: Seems quite good so far
customer_reviews.text: We recently signed up with Blue Apron and all of their recipes call for quite a lot of pepper. I spent probably too much time reading reviews of pepper grinders on Amazon, in retrospect, but the research seems to have paid off. The grinder works very well, is easy to refill, and I hope it will last awhile. The only thing I am concerned about is that there is a lot of plastic in this thing that could break at some point, so till we have a year or so on it, I'm leaving the review at 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Grind size does not change with adjuster. Takes forever to grind a small amount because it does not catch on the berries.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Cooper

customer_reviews.title: ... set of these from several years ago that work amazing. This set does not work AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: We have another set of these from several years ago that work amazing. This set does not work AT ALL!! The pepper grinder won’t pick up the peppercorns so we end up twisting and twisting to get nothing. The salt grinder leaks salt all over. I wish I could return these. Clearly the product has gone downhill the last few years. Very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Wide variation of grinds and easy to refill
customer_reviews.text: asdfasdf This is a great pepper grinder. It has a wide range of grinds, from small flakes (<1mm) to half the peppercorn. It doesn't grind to a powder like my mom likes, but if you want to actually taste the pepper in your food it's perfect. It also has a good texture on the twist part, the refill opening is a good size, and it stores upside down, so you don't spill pepper on the table/cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Does not grind
customer_reviews.text: OXO Pepper Grinder, Clear. I thought it was just me but I saw other reviews with the same complaint. The peppercorns don't get down to the grinding mechanism hence they do not get ground. If you turn it over and strike it on the counter, then upend it again you might feel a few corns fall into the mechanism and you'll have some grains of pepper but this is not the way it should work. Am ordering a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Martha L

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I love OXO products. I have everything from salad spinners to measuring cups. This grinder is the latest edition to the collection. It feels good in my hand. I like the ease of changing the grind, which I couldn't do with the last grinder I had. It even comes with the peppercorns. The best feature is that you grind it from the top, so when you put it on the counter it doesn't leave grinds all over. I had to put my last grinder in a bowl because it made such a mess. I know that may seem like a simple thing, but trust me, it's a big plus!
customer_reviews.author: MJZTop Contributor: Writing

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't put out much pepper.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use and nice looking, but it takes forever to get enough pepper out of it. I was trying to pepper hamburger patties and it would take about 10-15 seconds to get enough. I'm going to reorder a different one I'd broke that spits pepper out as fast as you want.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Consistent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product based upon the reviews and maybe I received a defective one but it does not work consistently. Sometimes I use and Im just turning and nothing dispenses. I try changing the coarse lever and still nothing. Other times it may work if I have it angled just right. I wont purchase again and do not recommend. I bought a Himalayan salt grinder from Trader Joes that work great. I'm looking into buying a different pepper grinder.
customer_reviews.author: MissT

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, requires percussive maintenance
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grinder for about a year or so, and it grinds pepper fine, as long as you don't need too much pepper. The coarseness adjustment is pretty good, but the grinder seems to get clogged during use. When this happens, turning the handle produces no pepper, and the only fix I've found is tapping the grinder against the counter top a few times to clear the grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Moomaw

customer_reviews.title: ... sea salt or some Himalayan salt and both grid nicely in this
customer_reviews.text: We use this for either black sea salt or some Himalayan salt and both grid nicely in this. The different sized grinds does allow different sized salt to come out and can change easily. Comfortable sized for my smaller-ish hands and turns easily because it has stayed sharp for grinding.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad grinder, complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The grinder worked great for the first couple of months of buying it. It now just spins the peppercorns around even after cleaning the grinder to see if any peppercorn was stuck that was preventing it from doing its job. It's a waste of money. I bought it after reading the great reviews but I see many more people are having similar issues like mine. May be the quality went down to bring down cost?
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: This product looks so sleek and seemed like such a great alternative to disposable pepper grinders that ...
customer_reviews.text: This product looks so sleek and seemed like such a great alternative to disposable pepper grinders that can't be refilled. However, we have had issues with ours. It doesn't seem to be strong enough to grind the pepper, and I find myself having to force the grinder or grind back-and-forth to get any pepper to come out, even after messing with the grind settings.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: GRINDS LIKE NO OTHER
customer_reviews.text: I love using THIS SPECIFIC pepper grinder because it will smoothly grate the peppercorn with ease! It sprinkles a generous portion of pepper in just 1-2 twists whereas previous pepper grinders took me at least 5-7 twists to barely get a dash of pepper on my food. I just spent 2 minutes reviewing a frikn pepper grinder so you know it’s been a struggle with previous pepper grinders... this is G double o D GOOD
customer_reviews.author: Lili

customer_reviews.title: Stopped grinding after a first refill
customer_reviews.text: Worked so-so when arrived filled with the original pepper. Often it would stop grinding and had to turn it while upside down to get it going again. After refilling with a high quality pepper (also bought here) it pretty much stopped grinding in all but the largest setting. So disappointing and not up to Oxo standard. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: foregood

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: When trying to grind pepper, the pepper does not always come out of the grinder. This grinder is a piece of junk. I bought it for the quality name brand. I will never do that again. I will be buying another grinder because everytime I use this one I want to scream in frustration. Never trust this brand again. I know they are aware their grinder does not work, but they keep on selling it. Update 2 months later- The more I try to use the grinder, the madder I get. The grinder is very bad. I think I will just throw it away and buy one in a store!
customer_reviews.author: zorro

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a quality pepper grinder. After reading numerous reviews, I decided on the OXO brand. Not long after using the product, the grinding ability deteriorated. Not much later, it was a struggle to get minimal ground pepper to dispense. I am thoroughly disappointed with this product. The inexpensive, disposable grinders from Aldi are much better. Please improve your product quality. I would appreciate a response form the company. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: The best salt grinder I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: No more dinking with the adjustments every time you refill your salt grinder. That was so annoying... tighten it a bit, a bit more, a bit more. Not only that but this grinder sits with the salt dispensing side UP! Which means it does not leave salt everywhere you store it. AND if that is not enough for you, it has ceramic burrs. What are you waiting for ? This is the best salt grinder I have ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. PinkertonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Total Cost, about $100
customer_reviews.text: A quality pepper grinder at a reasonable price. It works with the quickness. As functional as it is ugly. Add the cost of the complete collection of pepper grinders that are simply not productive enough or reliable, and my total cost to grind pepper with this fine device is just under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Josefina J. Deaver

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Grind Well and Gets Stuck
customer_reviews.text: I did far too much research to pick a pepper grinder and read almost all of the reviews on Amazon. This grinder had great reviews...unfortunately for me it just does not work well. I have had this grinder just over a month now and it gets stuck when grinding and sometimes just will not turn right. I am so bummed as I splurged on the nicer of the ones I was looking at and I really have not had great luck with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Buescher

customer_reviews.title: this is the best salt/pepper grinder out there
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this is the best salt/pepper grinder out there. I've used other ones & this one out performs them all. I'm 65 years old and my grip isn't as good as it used to be. Used a wooden pepper mill for years but it got very difficult to get a good enough grip on the top to turn it & dispense the pepper. The rubber base (or what ever it is) makes it very easy to turn. Also the ability to choose what grind you want to use is an additional perk to the unit. I have one for sea salt and now have one for my melange pepper corns. Happy dance time!
customer_reviews.author: Mary R

customer_reviews.title: Works great for grinding my Sea Salt
customer_reviews.text: I got this grinder to grind my Celtic Sea Salt. It has a choice of settings from coarse to fine and works like a dream. Easy to fill and use and being an OXO product, easy to grip! I am glad I purchased this particular grinder and think it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sooze29

customer_reviews.title: Spins without grinding
customer_reviews.text: Other than the fact that it does not grind, it seems very well made. But 90% of the time it just spins, it does not "grab" the peppercorns. I put up with it for a long time, but today I found a heavy, vintage, brass pepper mill at the Salvation Army. After using it a few times, I tossed this one. Grinding pepper is supposed to be easy and productive. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: PanzerPink

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Consistently Grind
customer_reviews.text: I normally love Oxo products but this one was not great. And based on other reviews, it doesn't seem like it is a one-off defect. The problem with this pepper grinder is that it doesn't always grind the pepper. the whole time that you're twisting the bottom. I often find myself have to invert it back and forth in order to move the black pepper around. The rubber that covers the bottom also does not seem like it will last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This will grind your pepper fine ...or medium; or coarse
customer_reviews.text: Others have noted the feature that sets this pepper mill apart: You turn it upside down to grind, so that when you return it to its upright position, whatever loose bits of pepper remain don't end up on the table but remain on the top of the peppermill. It has a solid feel. I have tested all the gradations from fine to coarse and it really works. You won't get the fine and uniformly ground pepper that comes ready-ground from the market but one assumes you're not looking for that in a grind-your-own device.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Not good at grinding pepper.
customer_reviews.text: This pepper grinder does a poor job of grinding pepper. Often it just spins with very little pepper coming out. The only way to reliably get pepper is to se the grinder on its coarsest setting, which results in too-large chunks of pepper. OXO is usually a good brand but this is a FAIL.
customer_reviews.author: James is Cool

customer_reviews.title: Different version than before.  Doesn't work as well.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work as well as the one we had for 8+ years. Looks the same, but doesn't work the same. Have to turn and turn and turn it, it barely pulls the pepper corns in. This is very disappointing, as the version we had before was the best pepper grinder I'd ever used.
customer_reviews.author: AlienElvis

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just the quality and ease of use I've become accustomed to from OXO. All around pleased with how easy it is to adjust the grind level. Clear body lets you know when it's time to refill; and easily to screw off the top to do so. Easier to twist/grind than the little ones from the spice section of the store (McCormicks & Kirkland). I'm glad we invested in this grinder. I even think it looks nice, and am happy to place it on the table rather than hiding it in the kitchen. This grinder comes with peppercorns inside.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Simon

customer_reviews.title: OXO 2154300 Salt Grinder, Clear
customer_reviews.text: I have both the salt & pepper grinders. I bought the pepper a couple of years ago and it has performed well. I have no doubts the salt will continue to perform as well for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Alpacamade

customer_reviews.title: Grinds very slowly, and leaves big chunks
customer_reviews.text: This pepper mill requires many turns to produce a small amount of ground pepper, and often produces large chunks of pepper regardless of setting. It's frustrating that there are so many low quality pepper mills out there, but this is yet another one, despite OXO making good stuff generally. I've heard the Unicorn is worth its high price, so I'll be trying that one next.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Krasnow

customer_reviews.title: It does not last
customer_reviews.text: Had this grinder for about 6 months. If you put it on small grind it binds up and nothing comes out. Same is true for the pepper grinder.Thought they would be good products but not happy here.
customer_reviews.author: dde123

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this grinder.
customer_reviews.text: There is little difference between the five settings. The grinding mechanism is ceramic and it takes forever to extract pepper. I got a year and a half out of it before it quit grinding. I will not send this back for repair as it has been noted by another seller that the replacement was no improvement. Spend the extra money on a grinder with a steel mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: George D. Heim

customer_reviews.title: Overall design could be improved and made more durable
customer_reviews.text: My mill lasted 18 months. When new - very happy with the product. As time went on particularly in the last 17 18 months - takes more rotations to get a good peppery coverage. This means manufacturer needs to build the grinder to be more durable -- or just pay more for a better brand/product with higher reviewer satisfaction. So long OXO - liked you while you lasted...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer 1X2X

customer_reviews.title: Turn, turn, turn, turn, turn, turn, turn.....No F-ing Pepper!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst pepper grinder I have ever had the displeasure of using. I like fresh ground pepper on most of my meals and I like a lot of it. This grinder is great if you have the strongest taste buds and can taste basically nonexistent pepper flakes in their food. The problem is the space under the grinding blade isn't big enough to allow peppercorn to pass through. With normal grinders, I can completely coat a plate with pepper in about 15 seconds. With the OXO grinder, it literally takes minutes just to be able to see pepper come out. This product is extremely frustrating and exhausting to use and depend on for your pepper needs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and pay a little more for a Cole and Mason ( ordered one and it works great!! ) - or go to Dollar General ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this grinder! Absolute junk!! My experience is that you can barely get any pepper out of it at all right out of the box much less after a week or two of trying to use it (no matter what grind setting you select). I was going to return it but waited until day 31 which is apparently too long under their policy. I see why the manufacturer limits returns to 30days on this item as most of them probably don't last that long. Save your money and pay a little more for a Cole and Mason ( ordered one and it works great!!) - or go to Dollar General or Walmart and buy a better quality pepper grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Lee E.

customer_reviews.title: Grind size doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I love OXO products, and I love the design of this pepper mill, but the grind size doesn’t work. It’s always a very large grind. I have tried to figure out why, but it’s beyond me. The top grinder piece is supposed to move up and down based on moving the size of the grind left or right. My grinder piece is crooked and barely moves a fraction, which means I cannot get a fine grind. Until this is fixed I can’t give anything better than two stars, and that’s based solely on appearance and that it grinds at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Michael Frye

customer_reviews.title: SCAM.  Does NOT grind peppercorns properly.
customer_reviews.text: This pepper grinder doesn't actually grind the peppercorns, instead, it just spins them. Every so often after shaking it I get some pepper to come out, but for a pepper GRINDER this thing is a joke, and I'm so sad that I can't return it. Please don't waste your money on this unless you want a good workout getting the slightest amount of pepper to come out.
customer_reviews.author: Bmanicotti

customer_reviews.title: Nice grinder but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice grinder but the peppercorns tend to get stuck, depending on the grind. You have to move the grinder back and forth to free the seeds. Sometimes this is easy, other times this is a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Marie

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and easy to use. Love it! Bought 2
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I liked mine so much, I bought one as a gift for a family member who loves it, too. The size of the grind is easily adjustable with a slide. I particularly like the way it is designed to be turned upside-down while you grind--the pepper comes out the top. That way, when you set the grinder upright again when you're finished, pepper does not come out on the counter. It is sturdy and easy to use, not tough to grind (in case you have trouble with hands or wrists, as some people do).
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I've had this now for a while (maybe a year or so). It doesn't grind at all anymore. I am disappointed with its performance after such a short time. I have to "hit it on the counter" to get it to grind out any pepper. OXO used to produce some pretty good products; lately, products have not lived up to their brand status. Very dissappointed in OXO lately.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Adams

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this pepper grinder.
customer_reviews.text: This pepper grinder does not fulfill its basic function. It does not grind pepper. I have been a loyal OXO customer for years but this has left a bitter taste in my mouth. One has to twist the grinder for a long time to get a small, inadequate amount of pepper. I can't recommend it, and strongly recommend not purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Davis

customer_reviews.title: Made in China - Buy USA.
customer_reviews.text: If you think you can buy a decent pepper mill for under $60.00 forget it. Don't buy into the "ceramic grinder" bit. Go with a stainless steel system, gear, grinder etc. This was junk, plain and simple. First turn, one turn grinder stopped working wouldn't pick up pepper corns and bottom cap fell off.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mezzullo

customer_reviews.title: Functional, aesthetically pleasing, adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: I like the price, durability, and adjustability of this grinder. I have one at home an ordered another for my RV because traditional shakers always leak salt when going down the road. This grinder solves that problem, and looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: lunzie

customer_reviews.title: I have had great luck with OXO products
customer_reviews.text: I have had great luck with OXO products, including the salt mill which works perfectly. The pepper mill, however, has been a huge disappointment. It grinds VERY unevenly. I returned my original pepper mill complaining of this problem and OXO sent a replacement. Unfortunately the replacement unit exhibits the same problem - uneven and unpredictable grinding.
customer_reviews.author: Robbo

customer_reviews.title: Applies a significant amount of ground pepper.
customer_reviews.text: I am purchasing this item to replace the same item that I bought from another retail source over two years ago. It finally quit grinding the pepper after I discovered the refill pepper corns I was using contained tiny black pebbles that could not be ground and jammed the grinder, stripping the post from the grinding heads and now just spins. Nevertheless I bought another one. But I now have the package with the satisfaction guarantee as well as the address to return it to for repair or replacement in case the grinder jams and strips again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brown

customer_reviews.title: Lousy grinder
customer_reviews.text: Most Oxo products are high quality, but this grinder is almost useless because of the minimal output of ground pepper, no matter what the setting and no matter how vigorously you twist it. I've ordered a different grinder and will throw this one away.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: perfectly usable.
customer_reviews.text: Just average. Grinds pepper, but the coarsest setting is not coarse enough for my liking, which was my whole aim, so I will need to buy another grinder. Having the outlet at the top so grinds don’t end up on the bench is a good design though.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with other posters that the size selection doesn't change the size of the pepper much. That still didn't deter me from buying this grinder. The action is smooth and doesn't stick like other grinders. Also love that the thing sets on the base instead of upside down. If you don't mind the size issue this is a great grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Refillable.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than the ones from the grocery store, therefore very easy to use. Best of all, it is REFILLABLE.
customer_reviews.author: Bette J Ericson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product - Oxo seems to be going downhill
customer_reviews.text: We have bought many Oxo products over the years but this is the first one that has been really bad. It is a terrible grinder. It blocks all the time and is awkward to hold and to use. Definitely do not buy it. I wish we had read the reviews more carefully before we purchased it. I cannot understand who would give this product a five star review unless they are being paid to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff - Great Falls

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I had shopped around for a pepper grinder for a while and found that they either looked really flimsy or were at a higher price point than I wanted to spend. This is a great price and also a great product. The adjustable feature is really useful to change the size of the grounds. Works great and looks just fine on the counter thank you very much
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: We had another one that would only grind the peppercorn very fine, and needed one with more options
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and tried it out immediately. We had another one that would only grind the peppercorn very fine, and needed one with more options. This one works effortlessly and has 5 settings (for practical home use it only needed 3) --works great. Now I can choose what grind I want for individual recipes or personal choices.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan V.

customer_reviews.title: Great expectations dashed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always liked Oxo products. I bought this one with similar high expectations. But this product simply doesn’t work consistently - if at all. You can turn and turn the grinder with nothing coming out. I’ve tried changing the courseness settings and that may help - for a couple of turns of the grinder before once again, nothing comes out. I’ve even replaced the peppercorns with new ones from the store - but that didn’t improve performance. Ergonomically, this thing is fantastic - as Oxo products are. It just doesn’t grind pepper consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier Daddy

product_meta.title: OXO Salt Grinder, Clear
product_meta.description: Style Name:Salt Grinder| Color:BlackThe sleek and stylish OXO Salt Grinder easily goes from the kitchen to the dining table. This grinder has a clear acrylic body and stainless steel accents. Grind from fine to coarse with its adjustable manual grind. Its airtight lid keeps the salt fresh and its non-slip grip allows comfortable grinding. Hand wash only.
feature_bullets: Non-corrosive ceramic grinder won't absorb flavors or odors
Rotate tab to easily adjust Grinder setting from fine to coarse
Clear acrylic body highlights contents and indicates when it is time to refill
Simply turn Grinder over and unscrew cap to refill. Grinder rests flat when upside down for easy refilling
